It is for knowing a good thing when they see it, even if they donâ€™t see it nearly enough.â€ â€“ Unknown â€œWhen they work, long distance are the best sort of relationships, I think. steps.content: Send your partner a bracelet or necklace that lets them feel your touch. steps.title: Stay connected during long distance with frequent communication and visits.
steps.content: Stay connected during long distance with frequent communication and visits. It can be difficult to feel close to someone whoâ€™s physically far away, but there are many things you can do to make your long-distance relationship strongerâ€”and to make it last across all the miles! Here are some top tips for staying connected to your partner during your time apart: [14] X Research source Talk frequently: Have regular text, phone, and video conversations with your partnerâ€”talking face-to-face at least once per day is a good goal. Communicate deeply and mindfully: Donâ€™t stick to the superficial stuff during your conversations. Be open about your feelings and listen intently to your partner. Communicate quickly and clearly about any potential misunderstanding (which can come up a lot in texting!). Use technology: Take advantage of modern technology like dual movie-streaming services, shared playlists, online multiplayer games, and even shared touch technology like the Bond Touch bracelets and necklaces (that allow you to touch your partner wherever they are!). Start a shared project or hobby: Learn a language together, join a virtual book club, practice new food or drink recipes while on video chat, or take an online drawing class together. Plan visits: As much as possible, always have your next visit planned and trade off who is visiting whom. Avoid putting too much pressure on these visitsâ€”let them develop however they do naturally. Set shared goals: Discuss your aspirations and work together toward building a future together (where youâ€™ll both be living in the same place).
